p: The effect of the D15D over-expression in growth and lipid accumulation was analyzed in the strain Mc-D15D, as shown in Figure 4. The concentrations of ammonium and glucose in the culture medium are also highlighted in Figure 4. Adequate concentrations of glucose remained during the entire bioprocess ( Figure 4a), however at approximately 24 h the ammonium was used up by Mc-D15D ( Figure 4b). After 12 h of cultivation, cell dry weight (CDW) increased rapidly but slowed down after nitrogen depletion ( Figure 4c). The fungus started to accumulate lipids immediately after nitrogen exhaustion from the culture medium. The total fatty acids (TFAs) content increased rapidly from 24 h, reaching its peak at 60 h and then slowed gradually. The maximum content of TFAs was found to be 15.53% in Mc-D15D ( Figure 4d).
